Text: Ughh...
A surviving bandit?
Can't beâ€”we made sure of that. Which means...
Over there! It's coming from under the rubble!

The three of us work together to move the debris and
uncover the girl lying beneath it.

The collapsed rubble has broken her limbs,
but there's something else...
These symptoms... She's possessed!

I thought those bandits were behind the rumors,
but there really was one of the possessed here!

She must've been hiding from the bandits in this
house when it collapsed.

She should've died instantly, but her possession may
have helped her survive.

Ironic how the very power loathed by many is what
saved her.

Maybe for the girl, she would have been happier if
she had died a swift death here.
...Kill...me... I can't...take it anymore...
I don't wanna be...possessed! Lemme die now...aghh...!
We can't. There's still a way for you to live.

Yet we found her, and now that we have, we will not
let her die.
Don't torture me... Please...kill me!

U-Um! There seems to be some misunderstanding. We're
not keeping you alive to torture you!

Don't worry. We were also possessed, and we're here
to put you out of your misery.
Put me...out of my misery...please...

Really, Lady Alpha? You definitely could've worded that
better.
True... It sounded less grim in my head.

At least she's resisting less. Hold on now, let me
cure you.

I place my hand on the girl's body and let my magic
flow into her. It's a delicate and nerve-wracking
process.

I remember when Shadow cured me...as if slowly
peeling away thin layers of skin...
Oh...what happened? It doesn't hurt anymore...

The overload of magic tormenting her body seems to
have subsided. The girl opens her eyes in wonder.

Hold still a little longer. Once I finish this, I'll
heal your bones.
Ahh...owww!

The girl's face contorts with pain as if suddenly
recalling her broken bones.

Looks like you can feel pain again. Congratulations.
It's a sign that you're alive.
A sign...I'm alive? B-But...
The girl anxiously peers into my face.

Are you sure I'm allowed to...live? Even though I'm
possessed?

Being possessed doesn't make you a demon. It's proof
that you're descended from heroes. Someone once
taught me that.

So don't say "even though." Have pride and confidence
in who you are. Trust that everything will be okay.
I speak to reassure the girl, and myself as well.

My first time healing a possessed. I'm worried about
the results, but I can't let the girl see my anxiety.

Zeta scolded me for shouldering too much, but this
is one thing I must shoulder.

I'm responsible for driving the Shadow Garden forward
and leading my comradesâ€”my family of possessed.
Okay...

The girl slowly shuts her eyes again as a gentle,
relieved smile appears on her lips.
I don't really...understand...but...
I feel happy...I'm not alone...
Don't worry. She's just fallen asleep.
How's the cure coming along? Did you finish it?
Yes. The magic overload should be fully contained.

I notice my sweaty bangs sticking to my forehead for
the first time.

I wipe the sweat from my face and aware of how heavy
my arm feels. I must have used a considerable amount
of energy.

Great job. You managed to pull it off on your first
attempt. That's incredible.

I practiced again and again in my head...but I'm
still relieved it worked.

A part of me had fretted over what would happen if I
failed.

But the girl believed in me, and Beta and Zeta helped
me by standing by my side.
I've got you two to thank.
But I didn't do anything...
Actually, you did.

That's right. I couldn't allow myself to mess up
while they were there to see it.

We should probably head back to our hideout.
I'll carry the girl.

You're right. The Cult may turn up, but right now,
our priority is to help her recover.
I will...become...stronger!

Beta proclaims this as she clenches her fists
tightly.

Haste makes waste, Beta. Now's the time to build up
your strength...
Understood...!
On our way out of the village, I suddenly stop.

Although it was just a rumor this time, it's not
unheard of for the possessed to indeed go
berserk.

The life or death of an innocent human had been
entrusted into my hands. As the realization dawns
on me, I gaze at my palms.

They're still drenched in sweat and haven't ceased
trembling since saving the girl's life.

Shadow, you've been carrying out this heavy burden all
alone.

Only after experiencing it myself do I understand the
weight of responsibility. Once again, I'm awestruck
by your greatness.
You really are amazing.

And silently, I thank him for enduring tremendous
pressure to save my life.
